roleset.name: shape
roleset.note: SHAPE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls build-26.1-1, engender-27, reflexive_appearance-48.1.2. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from shape.01-v)
SHAPE-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry shape.01. Corresponds to Vncls build-26.1-1, engender-27, reflexive_appearance-48.1.2. (from shape.01-n)
SHAPED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from shaped.01-j)

role.descr: end state, if different from arg1

example.name: transitive
example.text: While the earnings picture confuses, observers say [the major forces]-1 expected *trace*-1 to shape the industry in the coming year are clearer.

example.name: with end state
example.text: John's experiences in grad school shaped him into a bitter old man.

example.name: No agentive shaper, within LVC.
example.text: Once an environment that-1 *T*-1 has taken shape over millions of years is destroyed, it is usually beyond man's ability to undo the damage.

example.name: ShapING, all arguments
example.text: Pasting newspaper clippings, photographs, sketches, and memorabilia onto the diary's pages further contributed to her shaping of the diary into a book.

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: The year was already shaping up as a difficult one for the recreational vehicle industry, which makes products such as motor homes, travel trailers, folding campers and van conversions.
example.arg: as a difficult one for the recreational vehicle industry, which makes products such as motor homes, travel trailers, folding campers and van conversions

example.name: oh grow up!
example.text: John-1 needs *trace*-1 to shape up if he's not to be kicked out of school.
example.arg: if he's not to be kicked out of school.

example.name: With reformer
example.text: [the a new general Jay Hood who 's down there]-2 clearly wants *PRO*-2 to shape this place up.
